segments.text: I am honestly getting quite frustrated watching this kitchen unfold.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can the woman possibly not hear the rushing water from the sink?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's pouring over the edge in a continuous sheet!
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She is standing in a puddle, completely oblivious to the fact her home is being flooded.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And those children! What are they thinking, climbing on such a flimsy stool?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: They're going to fall and hurt themselves, all for a cookie.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It makes me so angry to see such avoidable dangers playing out.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Someone needs to step in and fix this mess immediately.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The thought of all that potential water damage is truly infuriating.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This entire situation is just a chaotic display of unawareness.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just want to shout at them to stop everything right now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's a wonder how these things happen in a seemingly normal household.
segments.speaker: PAR
